group_1.narration: That old couple was still under the@influence of my suggestion, luckily.
I told them a friend was going to come over@and headed to the place where@me and Hanna were gonna meet up.
I was early,@but Hanna was already waiting there.
I haven't used any suggestions on myself today.
I need to have a clear mind if I'm to fool her...
But I'm getting more and more anxious.
So I used my magic...@and my nervousness suddenly vanished.

group_1.textLeft: I was supposed to prepare dinner,@but Mom already started cooking...
Hey, Mom! I'll do the rest!
Yeah! Cooking bean sprouts is my specialty!
Fine, fine, I'll leave the cooking to you...@Welcome, Hanna.

group_1.textRight: Ah, um, nice to meet you...
The pleasure is all ours.@Thank you so much for coming to see us.

group_1.textLeft: That's right. Now you get it, right?
My friend Hanna is a perfectly upstanding girl.

group_1.textRight: Right, right. You should shape up too!@Learn not to be so overprotective!

group_1.textLeft: Hanna, eat as much as you want today!
I'm gonna make you the best meal@you've ever had!
Mooom!@I told you I'd prepare dinner myself!

group_1.narration: I grabbed Hanna's hand@and we headed towards the kitchen.
I had her thoroughly deceived.
And yet...@This scene was exactly what@I had been dreaming of...
―Mikoto―@Sorry that I made you help me.
―Hanna―@It's fine, I don't mind lending you a hand...@But I can't do all that much, alright?
Cooking with Hanna...
At the dinner table was the old couple,@not screaming or arguing with each other,@just looking at us with quiet smiles.
It really looked as though they were@my actual parents.
No, by now it's fine@to think of them as my parents.@I'm sure I did the right thing.
―Mikoto―@Agh, Hanna!@It's boiling over!
―Hanna―@Yeah, it is.
―Mikoto―@Don't just stand there with your arms crossed!@Turn the stovetop off!
I'm having so much fun...
...This must be what people call happiness.
I was enjoying the common happiness@that I always wanted.
This Dad won't hit anyone or steal money.
He'll always protect me,@because I will convince him to do it.
He'll be nice and love his family...@He'll be the father I wanted.
And Mom will be the same way...
She'll acknowledge me.@She won't just forget about me@and go have fun on her own.
She will always protect me,@because I will convince her to do it.
I thoroughly convinced them that I also@like these slightly sweet rolled omelettes,
so they made some for me.
They would do anything I asked of them...
I can just turn this perfect family@into my real one.
Then, lies will become the truth,@and Hanna will never hate me.
It might even fix@my relationship with my classmates...
It's nothing but upsides...@It's like a dream come true!
Starting now, this will become my reality.@I'll cast an unbreakable suggestion on myself.
I'll leave behind my past...
―Mikoto―@Hehe...@This sure is fun, Hanna.
―Hanna―@Hey...
―Mikoto―@What is it?
―Hanna―@Why do you look so sad?
―Mikoto―@...Uh, what?@I think I misheard you.
―Hanna―@You know how sometimes you talk about@your family and school?
―Hanna―@You aaalways say how blessed you are...
―Hanna―@I used to think you were bragging,@but I was wrong, wasn't I?
―Hanna―@You're trying to convince yourself you're happy.
―Hanna―@I don't know what sort of troubles you have, but...
―Hanna―@Aren't you trying too hard?
―Mikoto―@...What are you talking about?@I'm just really lucky, you know?
―Hanna―@Yeah, okay...
―Mikoto―@Everyone pays attention to me.@It's like they're saying I belong here.
―Hanna―@Uh-huh...
―Mikoto―@But...@I'm not happy.
―Mikoto―@At school or at home, it's like@I'm not even there, not anywhere...
―Mikoto―@That's why I wanted you to find me.
―Mikoto―@I wanted you to stay with me.
―Hanna―@Uh-huh...
―Mikoto―@...What's with all this 'uh-huh, uh-huh' business?@Are you even listening?
―Hanna―@I'm listening. I get what you're saying...@well, only sort of.
―Hanna―@But if that's alright with you,@please keep talking to me.
Hanna was standing next to me,@without trying to do anything,@just staying by my side.
She'll always be by my side...
